availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. L. Moore (Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha J. Swansey Moore in Crittenden County, Kentucky, on January 25, 1849. Father of Rebecca A. Moore, Nancy E. Moore, Louisa J. Moore, Nicholas J. Moore, and Mary S. Moore. Farmer in Crittenden County in 1850. Farmer in Crittenden County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Critten County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 259A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 464.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 355A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Crittenden County Marriages, Film #000558428, p. 49-50.
"William Calhoun Love Moore (1822-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial #20995305, accessed January 19, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/20995305.
